getQueueFor() has 'protected', which might account for the error. If 
using Beanshell, you can call "setAccessibility(true)" to allow your 
script unrestricted access to private/protected methods/fields.

- Gordon

On 7/14/14, 6:01 AM, Kristinn Sigurðsson kristinn@... 
[archive-crawler] wrote:
> Hi,
>
> Does anyone know if it is possible to get the queue report for a single specific queue using its "class key" (e.g. com,example when using the HostnameQueueAssignmentPolicy).
>
> A quick read of the code led me to think that the following would work in the scripting console:
>
> appCtx.getBean("frontier").getQueueFor("is,apecs,").reportTo(rawOut);
>
> But this just threw an error saying " getQueueFor"  didn't exist (full error follows).
>
> javax.script.ScriptException: Sourced file: inline evaluation of: ``appCtx.getBean("frontier").getQueueFor("is,apecs,").reportTo(rawOut);'' : Error in method invocation: Method getQueueFor( java.lang.String ) not found in class'org.archive.crawler.frontier.BdbFrontier' : at Line: 1 : in file: inline evaluation of: ``appCtx.getBean("frontier").getQueueFor("is,apecs,").reportTo(rawOut);'' : .getQueueFor ( "is,apecs," )
